description: Europe editor Katya Adler looks at whether the negotiations are over after months of shadow-boxing.
title: Brexit: Have EU-UK trade talks reached a dead end?
title_page: Brexit: Have EU-UK trade talks reached a dead end? - BBC News
maintext: If pushed, the EU may well further water down its demand for what it calls "fair competition" rules - if, for example, it feels there is a robust dispute mechanism in place in the trade deal, that allows either side to take swift legal action, if they believe the other has broken their agreement.
